Grain.Do: Warm, cooked grains like quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), brown rice (1/2 cup cooked), oats (1/2 cup cooked). Cooked barley (1/2 cup cooked) is also good.
Grain.Dont: Dry, light, cold grains like raw muesli, puffed rice, stale bread. Limit very spicy or heavily spiced grains.

Legume.Do: Easily digestible legumes like mung beans (1/4 cup cooked), red lentils (1/4 cup cooked). Soaked and well-cooked.
Legume.Dont: Heavy, gas-producing legumes like black beans, chickpeas, kidney beans, especially if not well-cooked or soaked. Avoid sprouted legumes.

Veg.Do: Cooked, grounding vegetables like sweet potatoes (1/2 cup), carrots (1/2 cup), zucchini (1/2 cup), beets (1/4 cup). Warm, steamed, or roasted.
Veg.Dont: Raw, cold, bitter, or astringent vegetables like raw broccoli, cabbage, Brussels sprouts, bell peppers, raw salads. Avoid very spicy vegetables.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (small piece), cumin (1/4 tsp), coriander (1/4 tsp), turmeric (1/8 tsp), cardamom (pinch), fennel (pinch).
Spices.Dont: Overly pungent, heating, or drying spices like excessive chili, black pepper, asafoetida (hing) in large amounts. Avoid very stale spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1/2 cup cooked), kale (1/2 cup cooked). Well-cooked and lightly seasoned.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens, bitter greens like raw arugula, dandelion greens. Avoid excessive amounts of very bitter greens.

Oil.Do: Warming oils like ghee (1 tsp), sesame oil (1 tsp), olive oil (1 tsp). Use in moderation for cooking.
Oil.Dont: Cold, refined, or rancid oils. Avoid excessive amounts of any oil, especially when not heated.

Fruits.Do: Sweet, juicy, and grounding fruits like ripe mango (1/2 cup), banana (1/2), berries (1/2 cup), sweet apples (1/2, cooked).
Fruits.Dont: Sour, unripe, or astringent fruits like raw cranberries, unripe bananas, very tart apples. Avoid fruit on an empty stomach or with other foods.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Soaked and peeled nuts like almonds (4-5, soaked overnight), walnuts (2-3 halves). Dates (1-2).
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Dry, raw, or unsoaked nuts. Avoid large quantities of dry fruits. Limit cashews and peanuts.

Milk product.Do: Warm, full-fat milk (1 cup) with warming spices like cardamom or ginger. Small amounts of plain yogurt (1/4 cup) diluted with water (lassi).
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, ice cream, hard cheeses. Avoid yogurt at night or if feeling congested. Limit sour or fermented dairy.

Condiments.Do: Mild, sweet chutneys like date or fig chutney (1 tsp). Mild, warm spice blends (pinch).
Condiments.Dont: Very sour, spicy, or astringent condiments. Pickles, excessively fermented condiments.
